instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT: What is PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT? PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT is a 0.75v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SO-DIMM Connector B problem
threads.message:
Hi there i got a problem, 

i have board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> got a problem on So-Dimm connector B not work properly

i check <SIGNAL>PP0V75_S3_MEM_VR</SIGNAL> on <RESISTOR>R3305</RESISTOR> it's present
i check <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL> on <CAPACITOR>C3120</CAPACITOR> it's present
i check <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> on <RESISTOR>R3141</RESISTOR> it's present
i check <SIGNAL>PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> on <RESISTOR>R3250</RESISTOR> it's present

Any Suggestion ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SO-DIMM Connector B problem
threads.message:
You can try to resolder the pins close to the corners.
However, I recommend to max-out the other slot and do not waste time on it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SO-DIMM Connector B problem
threads.message: okay thank's it was intermittent i just replace <TRANSISTOR>Q3215</TRANSISTOR> sometime it's work and some time it's doesn't work
